title.narrative: Emergency Response to African Migratory Locust and Red Locust outbreaks in Southern Africa

description.narrative: The main objective of this FAO project is to safeguard the food and nutrition security and livelihoods of vulnerable people in the five African Migratory Locusts and Red Locusts affected countries (Angola, Botswana, Namibia, Zambia and Zimbabwe). With this CERF grant, FAO will mainly provide 400 kg of biopesticide, 4,700 kg of pesticide to treat 150 000 ha of swarming locust, 500 Personal Protective Clothing units (PPE), 225 sprayers for manual, vehicle and air control along with refreshing training to the Control agents and population awareness. The project covers Food security/Agriculture sector and will last six months. It will benefit 2.3 million persons including approx. 578,175 women and 578,175 girls.
